intro: Perdicium senecioides, commonly known as the golden ragwort, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in open habitats such as prairies and roadsides. Its yellow-orange flowers bloom in the summer, and the plant has feathery, aromatic leaves. Perdicium senecioides is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
